oNama.title: About Us
oNama.intro1: Our specialty is the development and application of innovative projects in the field of traffic safety. Members of our team participated in the creation of the "Law on Road Traffic Safety" and some of the bylaws.
oNama.intro2: Leading carriers, with over 2,000 vehicles, participate in our project to raise the level of safety in passenger transport. We organize professional gatherings aimed at improving business operations, and we also participate as lecturers at conferences organized by the Serbian Chamber of Commerce, Faculty of Transport and Traffic Engineering in Belgrade, IRU Academy from Geneva, and others.
oNama.vision: Our vision is to become a recognized leader in the development and application of projects in the field of traffic safety in the region.

firma.title: Company
firma.tsgIntro1: Traffic Safety Group (TSG) is the leading consulting company in the field of traffic safety and transport in Southeastern Europe. The company was founded in 2008.
firma.tsgIntro2: Our team consists of experts with long-term practical experience. Experienced team of traffic experts worked on more than 5000 cases of traffic accidents.
firma.expertiseP1: Results of the traffic accident expertise, represent the part of the evidence material that is used for reaching the Court decision. Therefore traffic accident expertise has to be done correctly in order for the Court decision to be based on the results of the expertise.
firma.expertiseP2: Traffic accident expertise can be done according to the Court order, order of the defense counsel or the prosecutor, order of the other legal entity for determining facts that are important for the further Court process, the parties involved in the Court process or any other legal entity for further business.
firma.expertiseP3: Traffic accident expertise can be done in order to determine mistakes of the traffic accident participants, but as well for determining credibility of the traffic accident occurrence, in other words - for detecting and proving fraud in insurance.
firma.expertiseP4: As it is written in the Law: "...Expertise represent expert activities that together with the scientific, technical and other achievements, give to the Court or the other entity in charge for the procedure, necessary expert knowledge that is used during determining, evaluating or clarifying legally relevant facts...".
firma.symposiumsP1: Beside traffic accident expertise, Traffic Safety Group (TSG) organizes International Symposiums: "Traffic Accident Expertise and Fraud in Insurance" since 2009.
firma.symposiumsP2: There is a rising number of litigations and procedures due to frauds in insurance. Among the accused, there were people from the police, traffic experts, claim accountants, liquidators, leaders of the insurance companies etc. Faculty for Transport and Traffic Engineering and TSG developed the models for finding out fraud in insurance and doing traffic accident expertise. Special attention is given to insurance companies, lawyers, judges and prosecutors, and everyone who is interested in the field of fraud in insurance.
firma.symposiumsP3: The usage of the Law on Road Traffic Safety is specific, thus knowledge from this field is systematized and prepared to make the work easier for judges, prosecutors, lawyers and other parties interested in correct usage of the Law in the procedures.
firma.symposiumsP4: Beside the differences in the way of expert expressing, the differences have been noticed in estimations and analysis of dangerous situations. In order to achieve clear expressing of the experts about causes and contributions concerning the occurrence and the analysis of the dangerous situation, at the Symposiums we organize, we recommend the unified way of expressing the opinions and analyzing dangerous situations. That is important in the process for the prosecutors, judges, lawyers and parties involved, so it could be clearly and easily understandable what experts could determine, and, on the other hand, what the experts determined.
firma.educationP1: TSG organizes training for safe participation in traffic and training for the use of PC-Crash software.
firma.educationP2: PC-Crash is the world's leading software for simulation and reconstruction of traffic accidents. The program is used by court experts, police forensics, lawyers and insurance companies worldwide.

ekspertize.title: Expertise
ekspertize.intro: When determining the causes or circumstances of an event, it is necessary to engage experts who, in addition to a high degree of knowledge in the field being analyzed, also possess appropriate skills. The analysis of the causes and circumstances of events in the field of road and urban traffic and transport must be entrusted to traffic and technical experts.
ekspertize.definition: Traffic-technical expertise is a field that uses knowledge from the fields of medicine, mechanical engineering, psychology and other fields. Experts specialized in the field of traffic are engineers or graduate traffic engineers.
ekspertize.importance1: The results of traffic-technical expertise represent part of the evidence material used in making a court decision. For this reason, it is necessary that the Expert's Finding and Opinion be done accurately, as the Court's decision is based on the results of traffic-technical expertise.
ekspertize.types1: Traffic-technical expertise can be done at the request of the Court, at the request of the defense counsel of the accused or the representative of the injured parties, at the request of another legal entity for the purpose of collecting or determining facts important for further Court proceedings, parties in Court proceedings or another legal entity for business purposes.
ekspertize.types2: Traffic-technical expertise can be done for the purpose of determining the omissions of traffic accident participants, but also for the purpose of determining the credibility of the occurrence of a traffic accident, i.e. detecting and proving fraud in insurance.
ekspertize.law: Law on Court Experts: ''…Expert work, within the meaning of this law, represents professional activities which, through the use of scientific, technical and other achievements, provide the court or other body conducting the procedure with the necessary expert knowledge used in determining, evaluating or clarifying legally relevant facts…''.

simpozijumi.title: Symposiums
simpozijumi.intro1: In addition to expertise, Traffic Safety Group (TSG) has been organizing professional international symposiums since 2009.
simpozijumi.intro2: The first two symposiums organized in Vrnjačka Banja that year had the themes: 'Traffic-Technical Expertise and Damage Assessment', and 'Vehicle and Pedestrian Collision'. These topics aroused great interest, contributed to the writing of quality papers and resulted in useful discussions at the symposium itself.
simpozijumi.fraudIssue: However, we noticed that more and more disputes and proceedings are being conducted due to attempted insurance fraud. There were accused people from the traffic police, traffic-technical experts, assessors, liquidators, heads of insurance departments, etc. Therefore, we turned to organizing professional symposiums with the theme: 'Traffic Accident Expertise and Insurance Fraud'.
simpozijumi.development: At the Faculty of Transport and Traffic Engineering in Belgrade and at TSG, models have been developed for detecting fraud and preparing traffic-technical expertise reports. Special attention is paid to insurance companies, lawyers, judges and prosecutors, and everyone interested in the field of insurance fraud.
simpozijumi.lawApplication: The matter related to the application of the Law on Road Traffic Safety (LRTS) is very specific, so knowledge from this field has been systematized and prepared to facilitate judges, prosecutors, lawyers and other interested parties in the correct application of the LRTS in procedures.
simpozijumi.uniformity: In addition to differences in the way experts express themselves, differences have been noticed in assessments and analyses of dangerous situations. In order to clearly express experts' opinions on causes and contributions related to the occurrence and analysis of dangerous situations, at our Symposiums we propose ways for experts to express their views and analyze dangerous situations, which is important for everyone in the procedure, i.e. prosecutors, judges, lawyers and parties, so that they can easily and clearly understand what experts could determine and what they determined.
simpozijumi.organization: Symposiums are organized by the professional team of TSG. We publish information on the main theme, prices, date and venue of the symposium on our website at least 3 months before the symposium.
simpozijumi.openType: The symposium is of an open type. Everyone who registers can attend the lectures.
simpozijumi.goal1: The intention of the Symposium Organizing Committee is to continue the tradition and improve the situation in the part of processes related to traffic accidents and their consequences - fatalities, injuries and huge material damage.
simpozijumi.goal2: The state loses huge funds due to treatment of the injured, costs of court proceedings and huge accompanying unnecessary costs that arise as a consequence of traffic accidents. Considering that the Republic of Serbia loses at least 3% of GDP due to damages caused by traffic accidents, and that about 2% of GDP is the share of the Ministry of Education or the Ministry of Defense in the state budget, it is clear that the costs for the functioning of 1.5 ministries, including complete costs, citizens of Serbia unnecessarily destroy in traffic accidents.
simpozijumi.goal3: The first two of the most important things that every person has are the life and freedom of each individual. Due to traffic accidents, both the lives and freedom of traffic accident participants are endangered, but in such a way that in peacetime the largest number of fatalities occurs as a consequence of traffic accidents in road traffic. Expertise of traffic accidents affects a fairer life for citizens because the real culprits are punished, and the damaged are compensated, unnecessary state costs are reduced and court proceedings are shortened.
simpozijumi.goal4: It is especially important that quality and uniform expertise enables citizens of Serbia to be equal before the law and to avoid punishing the innocent.
simpozijumi.goal5: With these Symposiums, we continue the path towards a uniform approach and solution to criminal and civil liability, towards a more realistic and fairer legal system and insistence that in this matter the influence of professionalism be strengthened to the level achieved in the developed world.

edukacija.intro: On the transport network of our country, on an annual basis, about 1000 people die in traffic accidents. Public awareness of the importance of traffic safety is at a very low level. The basic condition for reducing the number of traffic accidents and the severity of the consequences of traffic accidents is that each participant in traffic behaves safely.

obukaBezbedno.program: After many years of research and work on educating traffic participants, TSG established a training program for safe participation in traffic in 2008. obukaPCCrash.title: Training for PC Crash Software
obukaPCCrash.intro: Training for the application of PC Crash software is based on knowledge of the software package and experience gained during traffic accident analysis. In addition to knowing how to operate PC Crash, you can also learn the specifics of using the program.
obukaPCCrash.specifics: You can learn the specifics of using the program, observed during the analysis of various traffic accident cases, in a very short time.
obukaPCCrash.examplesTitle: Several examples of traffic accident analysis using PC Crash software
obukaPCCrash.about: PC Crash is a software package whose use makes it possible to more precisely analyze elements on the basis of which it is possible to determine the causes and circumstances under which a traffic accident occurred. The program represents a tool that 'quickly' performs very complex calculations that cannot be carried out using 'conventional' methods.
obukaPCCrash.requirements: For proper use of PC Crash software, professional knowledge in the field of traffic (especially traffic accident analysis) as well as knowledge of computer work is necessary. PC Crash is only an aid in traffic accident analysis, and the quality of input data on the basis of which the program performs calculations depends on the quality of the expert's work and the quality of material evidence from the File.
obukaPCCrash.precision: With PC Crash software, it is possible to precisely check parameters determined by 'conventional' methods, as well as more precisely determine those parameters that could not be precisely determined by classical methods.
obukaPCCrash.example: For example, it is often the case, in a head-on collision of a vehicle and a pedestrian, that traces fallen from the vehicle and/or pedestrian are recorded in the investigation documentation, as well as the stopping position of the pedestrian, so that 'conventional methods', using formulas, calculate the speed of the vehicle at the moment of collision based on the distance the pedestrian was thrown. The speed calculated in this way can have a deviation of ±10%, taking into account only the throwing distance of the pedestrian determined experimentally for a pedestrian of average height and weight, while PC Crash analyzes other details important for precise accident analysis, such as the height and weight of the pedestrian, the mutual position of the vehicle and the pedestrian (which can be determined based on the pedestrian's injuries), the characteristics of the vehicle involved in the accident (vehicle weight, number and weight of people in the vehicle, geometric characteristics of the vehicle, etc.).
obukaPCCrash.advanced: PC Crash can help determine the place of collision when traces of the traffic accident are not (or are not quality) recorded. For example, in cases where traces of the traffic accident are not recorded, but vehicle damage is recorded, vehicle stopping positions, directions of vehicle movement are known and injuries to persons in the vehicles are described. Based on the damage, it is possible to precisely determine the mutual position of the vehicles at the moment of collision, and taking into account the injuries to persons in the vehicle, it is possible to estimate the speeds at which the vehicles were driven at the moment of collision. Based on this evidence, using PC Crash software, the collision site is 'searched for', which is possible to determine. This method of determining the collision site requires large time losses.

projekti.title: Projects
projekti.intro: The TSG team participated in the development and implementation of projects from various fields. A large number of these projects were implemented for the first time in our region. For each of the completed projects, it was most important to design the desired level of traffic safety.
projekti.passengerIntro: Development of the Project for Safe Passenger Transport began in December 2004. Project implementation began in May 2009. The project goal is to improve the level of traffic safety among Carriers engaged in public mass passenger transport.
projekti.statistics1: In the period from 1988 to 2007, more than 920,000 traffic accidents occurred on the territory of the Republic of Serbia, of which more than 260,000 traffic accidents involved casualties. In the same period, more than 23,000 people were killed in traffic accidents, and more than 348,000 people were injured.
projekti.global: Analysis of traffic accident data at the global level leads to the conclusion that more than 90% of traffic accidents occur in poor and underdeveloped countries.
projekti.developed: The experience of developed countries has shown that by applying appropriate measures (preventive, repressive...) it is possible to influence the reduction in the number of traffic accidents and the severity of traffic accident consequences, i.e., that traffic safety can be managed.
projekti.statistics2: In the period from 2005 to 2009, 24,226 traffic accidents involving buses occurred on the territory of the Republic of Serbia (excluding Kosovo and Metohija). In these traffic accidents, 92 people were fatally injured, and 2,697 people were injured, and significant material damage was caused.
projekti.consequences: The consequences of socio-political and economic events in the territories of the former Yugoslavia have affected the reduction in the level of traffic safety, and even in systems where transport is a professional activity.
projekti.children: Data on child casualties during bus travel is particularly concerning. Our goal is to contribute to improving the level of public mass passenger transport safety by applying a series of systemic measures. Participation in the Safe Passenger Transport project is on a voluntary basis. In cooperation with the largest carriers in the country and other professional organizations, since December 2004, work has been carried out at the Department of Traffic Safety at the Faculty of Transport Engineering in Belgrade on establishing and improving activities and measures that carriers would use to reduce the risk of involvement in traffic accidents and the severity of consequences of traffic accidents that occur.
projekti.implementation: The application and improvement of the Project are of national importance, and the results of the Project's application will be reflected in the reduction in the number of traffic accidents and the severity of consequences.
projekti.support: The Project was supported by: the Ministry of Infrastructure, the Faculty of Transport Engineering in Belgrade, a leader in traffic safety among bus manufacturers (a company from Scandinavia), the Serbian Traffic Safety Committee, and other international companies involved in the passenger transport process.

article1.title: How to prepare for driving on vacation?
article1.subtitle: Find out instructions for drivers who are going on a trip during summer months
article1.intro: Many choose their car as a means of transport for some longer trips, for example abroad or to the sea. Due to frequent traffic jams and high temperatures, it is important that your car is in good condition so you can travel safely. Preparing a car for winter driving is somewhat more complicated than summer preparation because it involves winter tires, tire chains and similar equipment. However, there are also some rules for summer driving.
article1.section1Title: Check the oil level in the engine and air conditioning
article1.section1Content: Did you know that as many as one fifth of drivers drive with too little or too much oil in the engine? Checking the oil is not complicated, so it is advised to do it the right way. Checking the air conditioning is also necessary and is done before the start of the season. The check is performed by checking whether it cools sufficiently and whether it works at all speeds. Poor cooling means there is not enough coolant in the system. Gas in the air conditioner should be refilled every 2-3 years (or 4 years from the date of manufacture of the car). Often the cause of fluid deficiency is its leakage due to damage to the pipes. These problems are solved in a specialized air conditioning service. Another thing that is important for the good functioning of the air conditioner is the replacement of the filter. The filter collects bacteria and prevents them from entering the vehicle cabin. Car manufacturers usually recommend replacing the filter every 10-15 thousand kilometers driven.
article1.section2Title: Do not overdo it with vehicle cooling
article1.section2Content: Improperly adjusted temperature can be very dangerous. It is recommended that the difference between the temperature in the car and the outside temperature should not be greater than 5-6°C. It is advised that, if we overdo it and make temperature differences greater than 10°C, we turn off the air conditioning 15 minutes before leaving the vehicle so that the temperature difference can be reduced somewhat. Another tip regarding temperature in vehicles during the summer months is to park the car in the shade and use some sun protection for the windows.
article1.section3Title: Road safety during the tourist season
article1.section3Content: The basic thing is not to set off if you are not rested. Ideally, a half-hour break should be taken every two hours of driving. Of course, wherever you travel, it is important to comply with traffic regulations and signs. Never apply risky overtaking.

radioAppearances.title: How to implement new road projects
radioAppearances.description: At a meeting in Brussels, Serbia committed to agreeing on key projects in the field of transport and energy by the end of summer. Discussions on joint infrastructure for the Western Balkans are a step towards ensuring economic growth and a better life in the region. Milan Vujanić, professor at the Faculty of Transport Engineering in Belgrade, emphasizes that if we think about connection and cooperation in the region, the concept of the transport and energy system is the basis because transport without energy cannot exist.

radioAppearances.title: The advantage of wearing seat belts in vehicles is immeasurable
radioAppearances.description: From January to July this year, 290 people died on the roads in Serbia. There are numerous appeals for drivers to be more careful on the roads. One of the last ones referred to wearing seat belts. During a seven-day check, as many as 7,000 people were fined. The fine for not wearing a seat belt is 5,000 dinars, and recently this obligation also applies to the back seats in the car. Despite the fines and statistics according to which most of the dead are those who were not wearing seat belts, many still do not respect the regulations. Most drivers wear seat belts out of fear of fines, and there are those who do it for safety. Professor Milan Vujanić says that the number of deaths in traffic accidents can be halved by using seat belts. He believes that the advantage of wearing seat belts should be emphasized more often and rejects the demands of professional drivers to be exempted.

radioAppearances.title: Why drivers do (not) wear seat belts
radioAppearances.description: Despite a loud campaign and warnings that the police will more diligently check the use of seat belts in cars, as many as 7,000 people were fined during a seven-day check! Despite the fines and statistics according to which most of the dead are those who were not wearing seat belts, many still do not respect the regulations. Most drivers wear seat belts out of fear of fines, and there are those who do it for safety. Professor Milan Vujanić says that the number of deaths in traffic accidents can be halved by using seat belts. He believes that the advantage of wearing seat belts should be emphasized more often and rejects the demands of professional drivers to be exempted.
